Unnamed: 3: Description
Unnamed: 10: Specs of Photo

Unnamed: 3: Check for the trench depth, with clearly visible scale and Depth should be 800mm to 1mtr, less then 800 mm need deviation as per defined standerd
Unnamed: 10: Depth to be captured at interval of every 30 mtr in case of uniform depth.

Unnamed: 3: Check for the trench depth, with clearly visible scale and Depth should be 800mm to 1mtr, less then 800 mm need deviation as per defined standerd
Unnamed: 9: Start and End point of Trench
Unnamed: 10: Start Point photo

Unnamed: 3: Check for Protection used as per specification/ depth guideline
Unnamed: 9: Start and End point of Protection
Unnamed: 10: Incase of Undulation Start Point photo

Unnamed: 3: Check for the duct combination type defined as scope(generally 2X40mm and 1X3Way)
Unnamed: 10: Image captured during trench must have the Photo of  duct quantity and colour as per spec

Unnamed: 3: Check for the clear photo with 1 mtr depth clearly visible in scale
Unnamed: 10: Depth to be captured at Entry Pit reference point will be NGL
Unnamed: 11: Depth to be captured at Exit Pit reference point will be NGL
Unnamed: 12: Depth to be captured at Coupler Point. reference point will be NGL If applicable

Unnamed: 3: Check for proper clamping used in IBD/Bridges/Culvert
Unnamed: 10: At every 10 mtr interval clear visible picture of clamp/GI Pipe/DWC/DWC+PCC along the fiber route

Unnamed: 3: Clear photo required for barrecading around Trench area
Unnamed: 10: Captured photo must have the proper barrecading along the  work location with clearly visible barrecading along the trench

Unnamed: 3: Check for PPE and saftey measure taken by Vendor.
Unnamed: 10: Clear visual picture of manpower wearing appropriate PPE at every work location

Unnamed: 3: Check for DWC protection at road crossing and in case of NH/SH/Railway crossing additional duct to be laid.
Unnamed: 10: Prospective view Photograph of Road Crossing in which both end will be clearly visible with excavated trench.- Ongoing
Unnamed: 11: Both End Photo with clearly visible DWC/protection along the crossing with clear visible scale. In case of Railway crossing both end Chamber Photograph should be visible - Ongoing
Unnamed: 12: Backfilling Photograph in prospective ad side view- After

Unnamed: 3: Check for Deviation, if applicable then check for protection used as per spec
Check the duct used as per duct  combination
Unnamed: 10: Captured photo has clear visual of no of duct laid in Trench as per the duct combination at every 30 mtr interval or Entry exit pit in case of HDD

Unnamed: 3: Check for duct coupler in case of joint in duct.
Unnamed: 10: Photo has clear visual of Coupler location at each location irrespective of any execution mode.

Unnamed: 3: Check for clean and visible  picture of joint and Loop MH. HH bed, cable duct entry,
Unnamed: 10: Top view of Chamber in Construction phase where chamber frame is clearly visible and number of iron rod should be visible as per spec. - Ongoing
Unnamed: 12: Facing Left -with chamber visible in photo
Unnamed: 13: Facing right -with chamber visible in photo

Unnamed: 3: Check for duct entry
Unnamed: 10: Picture has clear and close view of duct entry in Chamber from bottom side, with no visible mark of crack in chamber wall, also the entry point is sealed.

Unnamed: 3: Check for Loop of 20 mtr in case of Loop Chamber and in case of Splice chamber 20mtr cable loop required for both end.
Unnamed: 10: Top view picture of chamber where cable loop is visible and tied with cable tie at 4 places at all applicable locations and applicable chamber type.

Unnamed: 3: Chek for simplex plug used
Unnamed: 10: Top close view of chamber with clear visuals of End plug/simplex plug.

Unnamed: 3: Check for the cable id, this will help in Mat reco
Unnamed: 10: Photo with clear visual of cable id marked in cable

Unnamed: 3: Check for Deviation, if applicable then check for protection used as per spec
Check for all fiber OTDR trace
Clear visible photos of splice tray with transport tube/sleeve placement/fiber routing/ cable tie/no external tape should used inside tray
Unnamed: 10: Clear close view picture of tray with visible fiber entry point, transport tube, sleeve placement, fiber routing without any external tape , also check if two fiber is spliced in single sleev,  sleev plaved at another location instead of its casset location.

Unnamed: 1: Cable Entry point in closure sealed
Unnamed: 3: Check for heat shrink and JC port sealing properly
Unnamed: 10: Closeup photo of cable entry port sealed with heat srink.

Unnamed: 3: Check for Clear visible cable tag for all ends
Unnamed: 10: closeup photo of cable tag tied over cable at cable entry point of JC

Unnamed: 3: After getting approved from Manager, Punch Point rectification photos to be checked and give final approval for Asbuilt.
Unnamed: 10: Photo must have the clear visual of the Punch point -like HH cover is not as per spec,  High loss in cable etc-  it may be document and Photo at all applicable location- Before
Unnamed: 11: Photograph of Ongoing rectification work of PP entity,  Photo quantity may be different depends on type of Entity, such as in case of Loss- rectified OTDR trace is required as supporting, in case of broken chamber lid Photo of raw materials are also required.-Ongoing
Unnamed: 12: Photo/Doc  of Rectified PP is clearly visible in case of Point entity and line entity.

Unnamed: 3: Check for AT document -  Including MB sheet, Material Reconciliation, KMZ, Drawing, SLD, ABD , HDD graph,
Unnamed: 10: All Documents/Photograph as per appropriate Specification  to be checked MB sheet, Material Reconciliation, KMZ, Drawing, SLD, ABD , HDD graph, Deviations approval documents.

Unnamed: 3: ROW application length to be checked
Unnamed: 10: ROW application form in Digital or Paper or scanned picture

Unnamed: 3: DN length to be match with route and Application length
Unnamed: 10: DN received document in digital/Paper / scan

Unnamed: 3: Check for payment receipt and validate the DN and Application length
Unnamed: 10: Payment receipt in digital form/Paper receipt/ scanned receipt

Unnamed: 3: Check the permit copy with Application DN -Length and Location
